q1.question: What is Tessera and how does it simplify the process of ticket releases?
q1.answer: Tessera is a user-friendly platform designed to streamline the process of creating and managing ticket releases. It allows event managers to easily customize ticket releases, manage attendees, and ensure a smooth experience by integrating attendee preferences such as food choices and allergies. For attendees, Tessera simplifies the ticket request process, offering various distribution methods like lottery systems or first-come-first-serve, removing the hassle of filling out extensive forms.

q2.question: How do I become an event manager and create a team on Tessera?
q2.answer: To become an event manager, you need to create a team. Currently, teams can be set up by contacting us directly. After creating your team, you can start crafting ticket releases and inviting other members to your team for assistance in managing the events.

q3.question: What are the different ways tickets can be distributed to users on Tessera?
q3.answer: Tessera offers unique ticket distribution methods, including a lottery system and a first-come-first-serve system. Instead of purchasing tickets directly, users request tickets. After the ticket release closes, the chosen allocation method is employed to distribute tickets fairly among users.

q4.question: How can I manage my event details and ticket releases?
q4.answer: Tessera provides a comprehensive event management section where you can edit event details, manage ticket releases, and allocate tickets. You can manage all aspects of your event, including editing ticket batches and details, from the 'Manage Event'.

q5.question: What is a 'Reserved Ticket Release,' and how does it work?
q5.answer: A Reserved Ticket Release is a special type of ticket release where tickets are reserved for specific users. Access to these tickets requires a promo code. This feature is useful for private events or for offering priority access to certain attendees.

q6.question: Can I edit or add more ticket releases and ticket types after creating an event?
q6.answer: Yes, Tessera is flexible. You can edit your event details, add or edit ticket releases, and adjust ticket batches at any time through the 'Edit Event' section. Tessera allows you to adapt the event details to ensure everything is set up perfectly for your needs.

q7.question: What happens if I need to cancel a ticket request or a ticket?
q7.answer: If you need to cancel a ticket request or a ticket, you can do so by accessing the 'Your Tickets' or 'Your Ticket Requests' section in your profile. However, please note that cancellations are final and cannot be undone. If you give up a ticket, it will be passed on to the next person in line.

q8.question: How are food preferences and allergies handled for event attendees?
q8.answer: Tessera allows attendees to input their food preferences and any allergies or dietary restrictions during the ticket request process. Event managers can easily access this information to accommodate attendees' needs and ensure an enjoyable experience for everyone.

q9.question: How can I pay for my tickets, and what is the payment policy?
q9.answer: If you're allocated a ticket after the ticket release, you'll receive instructions to complete your payment within a specified time frame. It's important to pay within this period to secure your ticket, as unpaid tickets will be offered to the next person in line. Payment methods and detailed instructions are provided in the 'Tickets' section of your profile.

q10.question: What's the different between a Ticket and a Ticket Request?
q10.answer: Since users don't buy tickets upfront, they instead request a ticket, which in simple terms means the user shows interest in attending the event. Once the tickets have been allocated, the request turns into a ticket if you received a ticket, or a reserve spot if you were put on the waiting list.
